entry.title: Columba
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 132,424Chapters: 23/27Kudos: 206

Summary: Buck held the little plastic bird close in front of his eyes, twisting it back and forth. “You can say it, Buck,” Eddie encouraged, quietly. “To put it out there in… the universe. And you’ll see her tomorrow, anyway.” “I think…” Buck took a huge breath, breathing deep into his chest, past the hurt, past the hard rock of anxiety that sat at its center, past the tears welling in his eyes; he aimed all of it back out, straight into the heart of the deep, deep universe. “I think I met my daughter tonight.”   or; A work of fate or God or man or the universe crosses the paths of Buck and a small, green-eyed girl with a bird in her palm and the future in her snaggle-toothed grin. Two and a half years after the events of Lighthouse, the Diazes become the Diazes.

But Evelyn just wants her freedom, will they ever be able to get over the hurdles that life brings them?

entry.title: Six Bucks Walk into a Bar
entry.summary:
Author: spideykell

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,378Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 42

Summary: “Construction worker,” Buck began slowly. His eyes shifted to Hen, then continued down the line, quickly passing over Eddie as he viewed them all. “Ranch hand. Navy man? Sailor?” His eyes widened. “Wait. Construction worker, ranch hand, Navy Seal trainee, stripper, bartender. You guys are me! The me’s before I joined the LAFD.” “We have a winner!” Chimney announced. “Didn’t know if you had it in you, Buckley.” “How— Why—?” Buck spluttered. “Because it’s funny,” Ravi said, clapping Buck on the shoulder. “We drew from a hat,” Hen explained. “I think it worked out pretty well. Thank god Bobby didn’t pull what Eddie did. Athena is the only one who needs to see anything like that.” ~~~~~ OR: The 118 all dresses up as different versions of pre-LAFD Buck for a Halloween get together. Eddie's costume leaves little to the imagination, and he takes authenticity to a whole new level.

entry.title: Tirami-speed date
entry.summary:
Author: buddiecanon118

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,299Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 69

Summary: When they get inside, they’re greeted by a cheery hostess standing in front of a sign that says “Speed Dating” in bold letters. They step up to the hostess stand as she smiles widely and says, “Hello, are you here for the Speed Dating event, or do you need a table?”“Speed Dating, please,” Ravi says, stepping to the side so Eddie can take his place between him and Buck.The hostess nods and hands them each a questionnaire to fill out while they wait for the event to start.“Okay, so, you’ll fill this out and bring it back up here when you’re done. While you’re going on your dates, we’ll read everyone’s questionnaires and determine who your best match is for one final date of the night. If you end up getting a real date with the match we assign you, we’ll give you a dessert of your choosing on the house.” She turns to face them once she reaches a few two-person tables close to each other. “Any question?” she asks, and when all three men shake their heads, she says, “Alright, here are some drink menus, and someone will be over to take your order soon. Good luck!” she disappears back to her spot at the front of the restaurant.Or, Buck, Eddie, and Ravi go speed dating for tiramisu

entry.title: The Code We Keep
entry.summary:
Author: alikatastic

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,521Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 22

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley wears two lives: a firefighter by day, something darker in the shadows. The urges that once haunted him now have shape and order, a code that makes him judge, jury, and executioner. Like a modern-day Dexter, he convinces himself it’s justice, one monster at a time. But double lives always leave cracks, and sometimes blood doesn’t wash away as cleanly as he hopes. Eddie notices more than he says.OR Buck lives by a code, balancing family with hidden blood on his hands. Eddie sees more than Buck realizes.

"No touching the merchandise, sir," Eddie teases.Eddie could set rules like he was a stripper. Buck pouts and puts his hands on the back of the couch. Eddie nods and straddles him. "Now, I know you are so good. I heard it's your birthday. Have you been a good boy?" Eddie asks.OR; Day 1 Lapdance for Kinktober

entry.title: Repression is my Heaven but I’d Rather Go Through Hell
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 33,941Chapters: 21/28Kudos: 128

Summary: For a heartbeat, neither of them moved. The morning sun glinted off her hair, the hum of a passing car filling the silence. Shannon shifted first, swallowing hard, her shoulders rising with a shaky breath. “Hi,” she said, her voice soft, tentative. “I’m… I’m Shannon. Eddie’s…” She faltered, her eyes flicking down, then back up to meet his. “Christopher’s mom.” Or, War didn’t break them. Distance didn’t. Shannon just might.

entry.title: What Came Spilling Out That Day (Was The Truth)
entry.summary:
Author: madame_bingo

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 65,193Chapters: 15/18Kudos: 229

Summary: God, Eddie was glad he wasn't here. He was glad that if anyone had to be on this plane that it was him and not Buck, or Bobby, or Chim, or Hen. But especially not Buck. Buck, who in less than 24 hours was going to have to explain to Christopher what had happened. Who in less than an hour was going to be his son’s legal guardian and he wouldn't even know it. Buck, who was expecting a call soon.   or   When Eddie's plane goes down, he leaves Buck a voicemail telling him how he feels, after all, he was about to die. Only he didn't die. And when he returns, Buck doesn't say anything about the voicemail and Eddie assumes that mean Buck just isn't interested.
